note.p: Birth: In the parish of St Andrew's Undershaft, London, England (02 October 1665)
Burial: Greenwich hospital old burying-ground, London
Education: Merchant Taylors' School; Wadham College, Oxford. BA (1686), MA (1689), BD (1722)

Career: Curate of St Benet, Gracechurch and of St Leonard, Eastcheap; Chaplain to Dr Grove, Bishop of Chichester and George, Earl of Huntingdon; Rector of St Mary, Woolwich, St George, Botolph Lane, and St Botolph, Billingsgate (1694-1699); Rector of St Alphage, London Wall (1699); Rector of St James, Garlickhithe (1708); Chaplain to Greenwich Hospital; Archdeacon of St Albans (1715); Rector of Launton St Mary, Oxfordshire (1719-death); known for his eloquent preaching and devotion to his duties; founded day schools in the parishes of St Alphage and St James, Garlickhithe, and at Bicester, Oxfordshire
Memberships: Society for the Propagation of the Gospel; Society for Promoting Christian Knowledge
Sources: Bulloch's Roll; DNB; Foster; Thomas
References: Obituaries in: 'Gentleman's Magazine' 1738, p490; 'London Magazine' 1738, p465; 'Historical Register Chronological Diary' 1738, p36
